div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

title.value: HL7® FHIR® New Zealand Base Implementation Guide

description.value: New Zealand base profiles
Adds building name, suburb, domicile code and geocode to the Address datatype

name.value: Condition resource for use in NZ

description.value: This profile adds the Long-Term Condition extension to the base Condition resource
This profile adds the Contact Point Purpose and EDI address extensions to the standard data type

The base New Zealand Patient profile

name.value: Practitioner resource for use in NZ

description.value: Practitioner resource for use in NZ

name.value: PractitionerRole resource for use in NZ

description.value: PractitionerRole resource for use in NZ
Additional authorisations that a practitioner is authorised to perform
Used to indicate what sort of alias is being used in a Location or Organization - eg that it is a legal name.
The name of a building cited in an address.
A full description of the conditions the health practitioner is subject to in relation to their scope of practice.

name.value: A specific purpose for which this ContactPoint dataType would be used

description.value: A specific purpose for which this ContactPoint dataType would be used. An example would be to indicate that this ContactPoint is used for video conferencing.
The date of death of the individual, plus the source of that information

name.value: District Health Board linked to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location or Patient

description.value: District Health Board relating to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location (Facility) or Patient (primary, physical home address).
NZ Domicile Code. Derived from a patient's primary physical, home address.

Represents an Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) address. It is intended as an extension on ContactPoint.system, with the system value being 'other'. The value of the extension is the EDI supplier, the actual EDI address is the value element. Note that a new extension 'messaging address' is preferred.
Educational qualifications a practitioner has. These may or may not be related to registration information.
The period over which the location or Organization is open
Funded NZ Healthcare Programmes
The official source of information held about a patient.
Long Term Condition Indicator. A long term condition can be defined as any ongoing, long term or recurring conditions that can have a significant impact on people’s lives.
The address to where electronic communications might be sent. For historical reasons, there is an overlap with edi-address.
NZ Residency status
New Zealand citizenship

The ethnic group or groups that a person identifies with or feels they belong to. Ethnicity is a measure of cultural affiliation as opposed to race, ancestry, nationality or citizen. Ethnicity is self-perceived and a person can belong to more than one group.
The Stats New Zealand standard can be found [here](http://aria.stats.govt.nz/aria/#ClassificationView:uri=http://stats.govt.nz/cms/ClassificationVersion/YVqOcFHSlguKkT17).
New Zealand Geocode. This uses a different datum from that defined in the HL7 FHIR specification for a Geocode.
Persons Iwi affiliation
NZePS Long Term Medication Indicator
The reason for a non-standard Supply Period.
NZePS Unusual Dose Quantity Indicator
Primary Healthcare Organisation associated with a General Practice linked to a NZ Healthcare Service, Location (Facility) or Patient (GP).
The organisation and person that created this role
The reason for the status. Generally only used for inactive resources.
The date the practitioner first became registered with the Responsible Authority or professional body
An indicator of the practicing status of the practitioner as supplied by their Responsible Authority or professional body.
The type or range of health services a practitioner is authorised to perform, as determined by the Responsible Authority or professional body.
A person’s sex at the time of their birth (considered to be immutable).
Suburb element of a NZ Address.
The complete set of alias types that apply to Locations and Organizations
Citizenship status
The purpose of a ContactPoint - what it is used for.

New Zealand codes for Coverage Types
District Health Board Identifer. Assigned by the HPI.
Datum codes used
The source from where the date of death was sourced
Domicile Code

Codes to record a person's ethnicity, drawn from [Level 4 of the Ethnicity code system](http://aria.stats.govt.nz/aria/#ClassificationView:uri=http://stats.govt.nz/cms/ClassificationVersion/YVqOcFHSlguKkT17)
Some sort of funded programme
The source from where the value of this item was sourced
New Zealand iwi codes. The 2 digit codes are abstract codes and provided in the expansion for navigational purposes. A user should not select an abstract code directly as a proper value.
NHI Use codes
Is the person a NZ resident
Primary Healthcare Organization
A coded type for additional authorisations
The code list represents the current practicing status of the Provider Person as per their registration with an RA.
The reason for the current status of PractitionerRole
A coded type for professional scope of practice.
Additional authorisations that a practitioner is authorised to practice or prescribe.
Used in Organization and Location to indicate what is the type of Alias
Is this person a NZ Citizen

The reason for the current status of PractitionerRole

A classification of the type or range of health services that a practitioner is authorised to provide, as determined by the Responsible Authority or other statutory authority (e.g. PHARMAC), that is, what the practitioner can or cannot do. It includes Scope of Practice as defined by the Health Practitioners Competence Assurance Act 2003, any special authorisations granted, and any conditions or limitations imposed by the Responsible Authority.
